This may smell modern/trendy or whatever but guys, you can get real perfume for this money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1767113"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1767113#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1760963" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1760963" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sneeky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482278"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1482278.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sneeky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1760963ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1760963" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482278">sneeky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-15">02/15/23 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The fucking licorice + tea has me in love at first sniff</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1760963"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1760963#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1759702" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1759702" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aikipy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1294237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1294237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aikipy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Rose-Cherie-69054.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69054.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Chrie"title="Rose Chrie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1759702ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1759702" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1294237">Aikipy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-14">02/14/23 04:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is love at first sniff for me! I had a feeling I would love it ever since it came out, but I was weary of blind buying it because of the licorice note, which can be tricky for me. But, oh my! How I love this one!  <br />
<br />
Its a gorgeous scent, sultry, but elegant at the same time! Its not obnoxious, it doesnt scream, but it makes its presence known in a powerful way! Best I can come up with as a similarity is Magenta Tanzanite minus the tobacco, combined with La Nuit Tresor A La Folie. Gorgeous, gorgeous creation! <br />
<br />
I decluttered A La Folie because, although I loved it, there was a bit of a cheap smell to the ingredients (I know, I feel bougie just by typing this!). And Magenta Tanzanite, I adored it, but the tobacco in it was a bit too powerful for my taste and it tickled my nose. Legacy of Petra is exactly what I wanted! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1759702"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1759702#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1756995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1756995" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rita.zaretskaya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/994275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.994275.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rita.zaretskaya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Alien-Goddess-68354.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68354.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alien Goddess "title="Alien Goddess "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1756995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1756995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/994275">rita.zaretskaya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-10">02/10/23 15:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How are we getting Angel Share here? I would *never* make this comparison if not for fragrantica.<br />
This is *a lot* less sweet. This smells spicy and medicinal (which I dont mean in a bad way, but it has that quality). I dont really get any of that in Angel Share which to me is mostly syrupy cognac.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1756995"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1756995#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1751770" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1751770" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ranchorita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/434112"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.434112.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ranchorita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Trudon/Mortel-46325.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46325.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mortel"title="Mortel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1751770ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1751770" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/434112">ranchorita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-04">02/04/23 10:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is a glorious blend for me. It's spicy and warm, substantial, but not overpowering. It calls to mind the sensation of being at the opera, and the heady swirling intoxication of the many luxurious fragrances worn by the ladies all around me. Glorious. This is love for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1751770"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1751770#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1748149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1748149" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="supertw94109"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066516"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1066516.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="supertw94109" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Embruns-d-Ylang-55251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Embruns d'Ylang"title="Embruns d'Ylang"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1748149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1748149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066516">supertw94109</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-31">01/31/23 07:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sprayed one spray on back of hand before bed and its still strong smelling in morning. Because I fell asleep before truly smelling all the notes I will say that my general impression is its an unusual syrupy ambery balsamic benzoin vanilla with a pronounced lingering bitter herbal green tea almost matcha not wet or transparent tea but heavier and dryer its very nice addition with fennel and licorice its more unique and stands out from myriad of Ambers. The bergamot did feature earlier giving a slight fruit accord that came through kind of apricot like. Very nice thick and close to the skin with only one spray and long lasting. Glad to have it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1748149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1748149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1737130" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1737130" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Neverapeoplepleaser"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1664252.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Neverapeoplepleaser" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Hindu-Kush-49030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hindu Kush"title="Hindu Kush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1737130ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1737130" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252">Neverapeoplepleaser</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-18">01/18/23 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is Halfeti's overlooked sister. Halfeti is loud, attractive but not particularly clever. Legacy of Petra is the dark horse. She's extremely clever, well put together and a deviant in the bedroom. <br />
It's the liquorice that does it for me. The opening notes are spice and amber but this fragrance develops so wonderfully into vanilla and aromatics until its turns into a liquorice dry down. Just wonderful. Good longevity. Ignore Helfeti, she's too brash. Go for Petra.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1737130"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1737130#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1735476" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1735476" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PijiRobyn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1067050"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1067050.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PijiRobyn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Intoxicated-25991.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25991.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Intoxicated"title="Intoxicated"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1735476ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1735476" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1067050">PijiRobyn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-16">01/16/23 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As someone who really doesnt like licorice, or anything anise tasting/smelling, I somehow fell in love with this scent. My friend, boyfriend and my mum who are like me, had the same reaction. <br />
<br />
At first its extremely syrupy, and very licorice/fennel forward. My least favourite part of the scent is the first 5 minutes. After that it blends into an undetectable amalgamation of decadence. Non of the notes stick out. Which is why I find this to be extremely masterfully done. Its like honey, or an elixir, quite dark, super ambery, without it smelling mature or nocturnal. It smells like liquid gold but dark, if that makes sense. Its not innocent. Its definitely a statement scent. <br />
Depending on how much you spray it can be a signature scent but if you like to go stronger, then it can be seen as an evening scent. Even though I believe scent can be worn anytime as long as youre smart with application.  This is a head turner 100%, youll get noticed. Longevity and projection are very very good. (Nothing lasts or projects in my skin). <br />
Its super addictive, I couldnt stop smelling my hand. <br />
If you like scents like Angels Share, Grand Soir, Ambre Sultan, Material, Oud bouquet then you might like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1735476"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1735476#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1732273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1732273" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavenderdeerling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1656621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavenderdeerling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1732273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1732273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656621">lavenderdeerling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-12">01/12/23 10:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like this. The first time I tested it I was thinking that it wasn't for me, but upon wearing it again I really enjoyed it. I find it very dangerous that every Penhaglion's scent I seem to sample has me tempted terribly into wanting a big bottle.<br />
There's something kind of fruity (blueberry-like?) to the initial spray of it before it dried down into a cozy licorice tea scent. It's just the right amount of sweet without being cloying, and it's a really nice balance of resinous/warm and fresh and clean. It kind of fades over wear time into a soft fuzzy blanket kind of smell, warm and vanilla but with that edge of clean laundry fresh from the dryer.<br />
The licorice and fennel are pretty heavy players in this. Being an indie perfume oil enjoyer, this reminds me very much of Nocturne Alchemy's Egyptian Licorice Tea with better longevity and a bit more depth.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1732273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1732273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1730770" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1730770" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosegold"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/985684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.985684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosegold" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1730770ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1730770" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/985684">Rosegold</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-10">01/10/23 19:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Full disclosure: Im not a fan of Penhaligons.  Their perfumes always feel a bit off and incomplete and are way to overpriced for what they are these days.  I saw this perfume make a few of the Best of 2022 lists and my curiosity got the best of me so I ordered a sample.  The contrast of myrrh and fennel and licorice is beautiful and really well done.  I was worried that the myrrh and amber would make it too sweet but its actually quite comfortable to wear and steers clear of gourmand territory. There was also a really yummy tea note that shows up which as a tea-lover was a nice surprise.  The downside: theres some sort of amber wood aroma chemical that shows up in the dry down and it just takes over the scent and it makes me nauseous. Im surprised that no one else has mentioned this.<br />
I am not having a good perfume day  :(<br />
<br />
Edit: Did some research.  The aroma chemical Im smelling is called Bel Ambre and its made by GIVAUDAN.  Its not as obnoxious as Ambroxan or AmbreXtreme but its still a no-go for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1730770"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1730770#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1722762" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1722762" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zkclaire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1503169.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zkclaire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75584.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Legacy of Petra"title="Legacy of Petra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1722762ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1722762" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503169">zkclaire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-01">01/01/23 18:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If anyone has a bottle of this, I'd be willing to buy it off you. Message me!! <br />
<br />
I don't smell the pure licorice some people are mentioning - its a licorice base with the spice of myrrh and green tea plus a slight hint of menthol (?) overlaying it. Along the same dark character lines of TF Black orchid but warmer and spicier. Amazing!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1722762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1722762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1716506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1716506" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emiguerra"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311083"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1311083.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emiguerra" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/1888-21616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1888"title="1888"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1716506ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1716506" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311083">emiguerra</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-24">12/24/22 13:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This all depends on how you feel about licorice, because this is what hides behind the rocks of Petra. And it hides until it explodes into a licorice bomb.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1716506"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1716506#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1715691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1715691" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thanasis_87k"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thanasis_87k" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Viking-41698.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41698.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viking"title="Viking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1715691ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1715691" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577">Thanasis_87k</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-23">12/23/22 09:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unisex to feminine leaning licorice bomb. Now, tea might come in front within first 1hr. It gives the sense of something sticking, sickly sweet like those -not so- dry figs you find in the bag. It is ok, probably more suitable for an evening leisure occasion</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1715691"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1715691#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1714054" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1714054" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peanutbuttercups"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280309.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="peanutbuttercups" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1714054ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1714054" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280309">peanutbuttercups</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-21">12/21/22 05:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love the branding. Excellent name, beautiful bottle, and as per usual with Penhaligon's a really enticing and intriguing story of the scents conception and what inspired it.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, on my skin this is pure, bitter, unrelenting licorice. Try as I may, I could not detect amber or wood notes. I think my nose is just particularly sensitive to licorice and as I don't like this note I couldn't seem to avoid it. I tested this rather than purchased it, for which I'm really thankful I live beside a Penhaligon's store as I know it would have been money down the drain. I was genuinely taken aback by how much I disliked this. <br />
<br />
Again, my views are subjective and perhaps on others different notes are more prominent. If you love licorice this is the scent for you and, truly, it does have excellent longevity.<br />
<br />
Sorry, Petra - you're not the one for me, not in the slightest.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1714054"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1714054#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1712502" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14977">fpih</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-19">12/19/22 05:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Loving this. For me it's straight licorice for the first 3-4 hours and then the olibanum starts to shine through and a bit of vanilla. It's a great scent that's almost gourmand but never quite getting there; in fact a coworker told me I smell soapy but warm and asked the name of my perfume so he could get it himself. Lasting power +12h, sillage rather strong for the first couple of hours, moderate later. It does share a certain similarity with Mechant Loup which I used to own, but this one is warmer and less cloying IMO.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1712502"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1712502#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1703700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Some sweetness too.  You really get that aniseed hit; but it's sweet, rich and ambery.  <br />
<br />
I just wish Licorice was my Jam for this one but I still prefer the more 'orthodox' fizzy sweet Cola bottles for sweet ambers.<br />
<br />
A solid try but sadly, not a buy this time for my wallet.<br />
<br />
My rating: 6/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1703700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1703700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696536" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Petra is the perfect spicy, sweet, woody-vanilla fragrance. The liquorice and fennel seeds notes really reminds of a Jordanian spice market. The drydown of this is similar to Maison Lancome Oud Ambroisie. <br />
Longevituly is great and projection moderate. The bottle looks amazing too. 10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1696536"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1696536#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1680342" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RobLfc88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1452289.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RobLfc88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1680342ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1680342" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452289">RobLfc88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-03">11/03/22 16:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>2 words. Liquorice abomination!<br />
Got a sample of this today and it's putrid... Straight in the bin</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1680342"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1680342#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1680025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It is close in profile to some fragrances but unique enough. I mostly get tea + a nicely blended myrrh/benzoin/licorice!! hints of tobacco leafs and vanilla sneak in but not that prominent.<br />
Considering a full bottle </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1680025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1680025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1676606" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369301">CCClydes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-29">10/29/22 03:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Stopped in to Penhaligons Edinburgh yesterday and fell in love with Petra. I know Im supposed to pick up licorice but my nose gets peach. Its a beautiful Peach Amber fragrance and the longevity is pretty good. I like Arthur (recently added to collection) but his longevity isnt the best. Petra has much more staying power. My new Winter favorite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1676606"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1676606#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1673842" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1673842" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherry_Darling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherry_Darling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pascal-Morabito/Perle-Pour-Elle-47506.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47506.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perle Pour Elle"title="Perle Pour Elle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1673842ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1673842" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821">Cherry_Darling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-25">10/25/22 09:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was a bit worried about the dominant licorice and myrrh voted by others but it's not dominant to my nose. To me this is an ambre sultan style, herbal amber, with lots and lots of deep almost masculine resins and subtle herbal nuances. Really nice and ambery, the herbs are failry quiet but present - not really distinct but give it a soft masculine greenness. I think it's a great one from penhaligon's and not too sweet like some of the others they have made in the last years. Not like angel's share to me I would say closest is Ambre Sultan but with different herbs. Starlight is much more warm / cardamom focussed I would not say it is similar. A little shisha bar esque to me also for some reason, there is a deep wood or soft tobacco to it. Big like! <br />
<br />
** So much tea in here makes it so yummy. Onto my best of ambers! <br />
<br />
Official sample available for swap UK - check customs for others, or ask, many more to be listed. 10+ sample bundles</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1673842"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1673842#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1660220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The green tea makes it dry and interesting. I don't find it sweet, sticky, heavily liquorice, viscous, or boozy. It's dry but warm and spicy. Very nice, with good projection and extremely good staying power (14h+).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1660220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1660220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1660126" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Licorice bomb. Because it's licorice based scent, every licorice based scent will remind you of this one. I get Sauvage Elixir vibes sometimes but this one is more soft and with a vanilla note. I find it more similar to Au Masculin. Sweet licorice with a hint of tea and vanilla. Very nice indeed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1660126"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1660126#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1655519" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I really like it I've used up the sample already .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1647050"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1647050#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1646205" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1646205" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scent.guide"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406103"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1406103.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scent.guide" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1646205ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1646205" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406103">Scent.guide</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-16">09/16/22 03:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is thick (in a good sense), warming and absolutely beautiful. Cosy and slightly boozy aromatic notes on top: anis, rosemary and cardamom (?). Viscous rum and raisins scent comes right after (this is probably a tea note, but this tea was definitely soaked in some rum :). It all mixed perfectly with stunning vanilla and smoky benzoins.<br />
<br />
Follow me on IG: scent.guide</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1646205"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1646205#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1642141" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1642141" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kotikina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1498532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kotikina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Attar-Collection/Khaltat-Night-38133.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38133.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Khaltat Night"title="Khaltat Night"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1642141ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1642141" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498532">Kotikina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-10">09/10/22 09:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is licorice heavy scent. I am not a fan of licorice, but here it is somehow in harmony with other notes. Sticky, boozy, resinous and sweet with prominent myrrh, very warm. Sweet tobacco in the drydown. I think I still prefer Babylon out of all trade routes collection, but this one is a very nice addition nevertheless!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1642141"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1642141#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1640204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1640204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aspronnie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351143"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="aspronnie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46504.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Bewitching Yasmine"title="The Bewitching Yasmine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1640204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1640204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351143">aspronnie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-07">09/07/22 10:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is heavy on the licorice - I instantly was remind of licorice confit sweets that my mum used to eat when I was a kid. Next I get a muddy green tea, and bergamot, then it turns into an almost sweet yet pungent tobacco, with vanilla. <br />
I like it, but I dont love it. After a couple of hours, it reminds me a little bit of Alien Eau Extraordinaire (!!) Maybe its the tea <br />
Anyway, performance is disappointing. After 3 hours, its all but gone. A vanilla trace left behind, and not much more. Sad times!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1640204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1640204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1638715" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1638715" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1638715ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1638715" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-05">09/05/22 08:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay, Petra is a good perfume, let's get that out of the way. <br />
It's really not very trendy to make a populist myrrh perfume (well it's becoming a bit more trendy) many perfumes with myrrh in the title often don't overtly smell of myrrh, at least not mainstream Penhaligons types shit.<br />
 Anyway this is a sticky myrrh biased amber with hefty woody tones and lots of discrete sweetness.<br />
Let's talk about the opening because that has the most overt, almost fruity and date like, caramelised, smell, I really love it and coupled with the most overt licorice which lasts throughout the entire perfume, I couldn't help but be wooed, in the initial phases at least. <br />
There's a bit of a downside here, clearly if you don't like licorice or anything verging on that, you're not going to dig this perfume or care about any other facets it might have, because it will plain put you off. Even me, someone who loves it, and thought licorice needed to be featured more in perfume at one time, could (and did) feel a bit fatigued by this because it is quite a heavy wear, and Licorice is somewhat of a recent trend in perfumery and I've definitely smelled it coupled with strong amber accords like this one before. (There's an Armani Prive one which is actually more subtle than Petra) <br />
However, I have to return to the fact that this is a really lovely, well made perfume, without any of the screechy, jarring BS of Halfeti or anything like that. <br />
Funny that tea is mentioned this does have some odd tea like quality, sandwiched somewhere between the resinous, tacky (texturally) myrrh and the dry, rooty, woody aromas, also the anisic quality of fennel (which I don't really get if I'm honest) IS actually a key component to creating that licorice feel. <br />
I'm onboard, I wouldn't buy it myself just because it didn't speak to me as loudly as I like, but I wouldn't blame anyone for being into it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1638715"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1638715#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1630976" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1630976" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Birdy716"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382324"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1382324.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Birdy716" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1630976ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1630976" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382324">Birdy716</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-25">08/25/22 06:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wearing my sample of this now, im suprised at how much I like it, sticky, heavy sweet and resinous. I definately pick up the liquorice note but its not overpowering, id say it was more suited to cooler weather. It does remind me of angels share but with liquorice, Ill be picking up a full bottle for sure</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="75584"comment_id="1630976"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Legacy-of-Petra-75584.html?ccid=1630976#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1618747" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
